name: hollowness

hollowness noun [U]
(LACK OF SINCERITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of situations, feelings, or words) the fact of being without value, or not true or sincere: Ann could find nothing but hollowness in his praise. Two law enforcement investigations have revealed the hollowness and fraudulence of the videotapes. the hollowness of fame/success

hollowness noun [U]
(EMPTINESS)
the quality of having a hole or empty space inside: The hollowness of the cave echoed with every step I took. You wanted to rap the heavy hollowness of those big bronze columns.
the fact of your cheeks curving in, or your eyes appearing to be deep in your head, because you are old, tired, or ill: There was a slight hollowness about her cheeks and eyes. The set of his shoulders and the hollowness of his eyes wrenched Steve's heart.
